DOC.brief_title: Effects Contrast Media Subjects With Stable Reduced Renal Function Undergoing Contrast-Enhanced Computed Tomography
DOC.detailed_description: Contrast-induced nephropathy ( CIN ) acute decline renal function administration iodinate contrast agent . CIN commonly define increase post contrast serum creatinine ( SCr ) great equal 25 % absolute increase great equal 0.5 mg/dL pre contrast baseline value . Study evaluate compare effect two ( 2 ) contrast medium product renal function subject stable reduced renal function undergo contrast-enhanced computed tomography .
DOC.criteria: Males females 18 year age old Subjects schedule clinically indicate CECT require 40 gram iodine ( 125 mL ) Subjects abnormal screen SCr result calculate eGFR < 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 use MDRD formula acute cause elevation SCr exclude Subjects stable reduce renal function define abnormal screening SCr measurement < 15 % difference old historical SCr measurement obtain within proceed 1 week 12 week Subjects must provide write consent agree abide site study requirement Subjects previously enter study Subjects dialysis Subjects receive investigational drug within 30 day contrast administration participate investigational study within 30 day prior study enrollment Subjects undergone procedure use iodinated gadolinium contrast agent within 7 day prior contrast administration , schedule receive additional dos contrast agent 4872 hour poststudy contrast administration Subjects acute renal failure one know cause acute renal failure Subjects know suspect unstable renal function Subjects schedule surgical intervention procedure within 72 hour contrast administration Subjects take NSAIDs ( exception ASA ) and/or type diuretic discontinue drug post contrast administration hold subsequent dos 4872 hour post contrast SCr drawn Subjects take aminoglycosides Subjects know organ transplantation Subjects severe congestive heart failure ( Class IIIIV )
